info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Motley, Hall and eastern Briscoe Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1130 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles west of Brice to 8 miles west of Quitaque. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools, Brice, Lakeview and Plaska Community. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
